name: Arizona Sunshine
description: Built exclusively for VR, Arizona Sunshine puts you in the midst of a zombie apocalypse. Handle weapons with real-life movements, freely explore a post-apocalyptic world, and put your survival skills to the test in VR - putting the undead back to rest is more thrilling than ever before.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows 7 - 64 bit Processor: Intel i5-4590 equivalent or greater Memory: 8 GB RAM Graphics: NVIDIA GTX 970 / AMD equivalent or greater DirectX: Version 11 Storage: 12 GB available space Additional Notes: VR Headset required, 2x USB 3.0 ports
recommended_requirements: OS: Windows 10 Processor: Intel Core i7 6700K equivalent or greater Memory: 16 GB RAM Graphics: NVIDIA GTX 980 / AMD equivalent or greater DirectX: Version 12 Storage: 12 GB available space Additional Notes: VR Headset required, 2x USB 3.0 ports

reviews.review_text: I almost never write reviews, but this game is definitely worth your time. Best VR game I have played yet and I am hoping there is more to come. 100% buy it now.  Edit: Just finished my first complete playthrough, wow. This is definitely the best game I have played this year, hands down.. (pun not intended). 10/10 would recommend and hope Vertigo/Jaywalkers puts out some DLC's soon!   Pros: - That last scene, wow.  - Mix of feeling like a total bad ♥♥♥ and also like you're drowning from moment to moment, this game has excellent pacing and beats.  - Good mix of weaponry and in normal mode, good amount of ammo. You can 'go Rambo' in some sections and not run out of bullets all the time.  - The music is a great guide, really sets the stage and when necessary makes you go 'oh, sh!t is about to go down..'   Cons: - You feel so bad when you reach certain parts of the game for the main character.. you'll know what I mean when you get there. (This might be a pro?) - Locomotion needs a bit of work, the click to move is somewhat startling at times, however, other than that.. literally zero complaints.    Want more of: - Zombie types - Missions, continued story line  Will update again after I play some apocalyptic and horde modes.
Amazing game. Probably the best single player shooter experience on the vive to date! You need to buy this if you haven't yet

Good but not great. Disappointed in the level of interaction with objects and the world; much less than I've come to expect for VR (Far Beyond anyone?). Reloads are arcady which isn't my taste but acceptable. And of course the biggest elephant in the room with this game is the lack of locomotion. The teleporting is noticably worse than other games but acceptable. There are a few ways they try to limit your teleporting which become annoying rather quickly.   Feels like a good start but I'm left desiring more substance. There's nothing here that is really intriguing except the characters narration. Recommended for zombie fans, meh for vr enthusiasts in general.

- Almost destroyed my ceiling fan chucking a grenade. - Nearly ♥♥♥♥ myself trying to fire/kill/reload/not die when a surprise zombie jumped out and I had my pistols holstered the entire time - Nearly ♥♥♥♥ myself after a zombie surprised me and I unloaded both of my pistols into it.   Definitely recommend this one if you have a vive or rift+touch - Just remember to be careful, especially when chucking grenades overhead.

Hands down the most polished VR game I have ever played. The campaign has a Left 4 Dead feel, but the immersion in VR is incredible. It's the first VR game I have played that actually feels full and finished.  I have an I5 6600k, granted I overclocked it to perform significantly faster than a non overclocked 6700k I7 and it automatically detected and unlocked the extra physics. Which are the best physics I've seen in VR.  VR is a tough field to develop games for financially. I think the developers did well in taking risks, listening to the community, and make the proper changes.

+ Proper gunplay and a good variety of guns, except the shotgun... + Decent graphics and performance + Fun little storyline with some tense dark levels + Horde mode for some replayability + Coop  - Annoying reload mechanic that seems to fail on the most critical moments - Jittery animation transitions which makes point blank defensive shots very difficult ; zombie parts like legs and heads sometimes shift way too erratically when translating in world space.  - SO MUCH MELEE weapons around and you can't use them, súch a missed opportunity. - Most ironsights seem to be vertically offcentre.  - Some scripted sequences suddenly close of nearby area's which were accesible before (and often offer the most cover). This is counter intuïtive and punishes the player for being resourceful. - Teleport mechanic could be a bit more forgiving when surrounded by zombies.  - Flickering directional shadows in some parts of the levels.   Conclusion : A decent story driven zombie shooter which could sell for a little cheaper. The campaign has a maximum of 5 hours of gameplay, lacks depth and feels a bit rushed ; There is a functional compass and lighter which suggests there were plans for some freeroam aspects and a more sophisticated inventory system. There are plentyful melee weapons around which you can pick up, have sharper textures than the other objects and anchor to the controller in a way you'd figure it's usable as a weapon. There are also quite a lot of consumable items such as water, medkits and soda cans around, which also seemed to have served a purpose (in the way they are distributed over the levels). This -really- feels like the developer should've taken/given a bit more time.  And the protagonist could be a little less alchoholic las vegas gambling addict, and a bit more charismatic? I dunno.
Awe some game! Right on top with the likes of Onward and Raw Data. A must Have!
One of the better experiences on the Vive
The best VR game out right now.

wow this game is amazing.  Naration is brilliant scripted and funny and hits the whole 'laugh in the face of a zombie' on the button. So far the chapters are well layed out and I really enjoy scavenging everything for weapons. I havent yet played this game on a harder difficulty but I'm guessing that the scavenging component goes on to include getting food to heal you, where as in the normal mode you recover within a short time.  I loved the chapter in the mine as it scared the crap out of me :-)  If you like brook haven experiment then this game is a million times better.  The only downside (could be my eyes sight) but i find it difficult to aim using the line of site on the guns and miss quite frequent when I'm not even in a rush to shoot. You could put this down to the recoil but sometimes I even miss when they are right in front of me and the wife played it and agreed (and we never agree on anything :-) ).  Well done developers!

Restricting game elements to certain hardware creates a dangerous precedent. Regardless of how fun I may or may not find the rest of this game, I refuse to enable my money to promote this unethical practice. I have requested a refund and will not be repurchasing this game until the developer makes all content available for all hardware, like *literally* every other game on the planet.
Very well polished! I'd say its the most polished game for VR so far.
Refunding due to Game Modes locked to specific CPU brand/type. Not going to support this type of thinking.

I can't say anything positive about this game. Locking out game modes based on CPU is unprecedented and I will not support a company that thinks it's okay.   Stay away from this one for the sake of gaming.
It's great to see longer experiences finally coming to virtual reality. Took me four hours to play through the campaign, which isn't long for the price, but, I think the horde modes will be a ball.
Amazing game even if it is on the short side

Played for about an hour and its already one of the best game I've played on vr, if not the best. Runs very smoothly, virtually no frame rate drops, love the health bar; the whole overall look and gameplay are both fantastic. I bought the vive pretty much just for this game and I am not disappointed.    I will say this, however, you never know how many bullets there are left in the magazine before you need to reload... That being said, it would be so much better if you could see that in a similar manor as you can for the health bar. Because if you reload prematurely you're just wasting ammo by dropping it on the ground and if you don't reload in time you'll lose health.   Looking forward to a sequel!

I've played almost 8 hours over the last two days, simply because I have really enjoyed this game... A LOT!  There seems to be a lot of negativity towards the game and some of the points are valid, however it gets a big thumbs up from me.   PROS: -Runs smooth on my AMD FX 8350 and Nvidia GTX 1080, with everything set to max. -Looks good, for a VR game. -I like the voice acting and the comments from the main character. -On 'Normal'setting I completed the solo campaign in about 5 hours, and this was well thought out if not a little simple in design (get this lever, go here, open the gate, turn the power on, open another gate etc). -Good gunplay! People keep comparing it to H3VR and Onward, its a totally different game! Its a fun arcade shooter for VR! -Now the Horde single player has been unlocked (I agree this should of always been the case!) it adds a lot more gameplay. -I feel it is very immersive especially in the dark levels with the torch....and I was as relieved as the main character to get back into daylight!!   CONS: -The price! I think for the length of the single player campaign, its expensive for a VR game.....but then its a Niche market and therefore the development costs for VR games is higher!  -Short length of campaign....I hope there will be some DLC to continue the campaign further (Free hopefully!) -The initial locked modes......however I feel it was very professional of the developer to listen to the gaming community and make the relevant changes. -Teleportation...it works, but it does break the immersion.  -Reload....a manual reload would add tension (H3VR has spoilt us) -No Melee.....I think less ammo and the addition of melee weapons would add tension, even a melee only option would be good.  I would have to say, buy this game, play it, remember Steam offers a refund service....use it if its not for you! I have no regrets buying this game, I think its everything a VR action shooter should be, and hope to play more from the same developer. Remember, the only goot Fred is a dead Fred! (sorry if your names Fred!!)

This game is just straight up fun. Controlling a gun in 3D space emulates shooting a real gun almost perfectly. The first time I ran out of ammo with a group of zombies coming at me I found myself hitting the ground and covering my head. If you have a VR headset Arizona Sunshine is a must own, especially if you have an i7 processor so you can see holes in heads and body parts flying.

Score 9/10  Should you buy? Yes.   Overview: I loved my playthrough of this game, and will likely play it again on harder difficulty. The point of VR is to be immersed, and I found that for long periods of time I forgot what the real world was. Took me around 6-7 hours to beat the game start to finish. The game has real grit to it, enough to make you feel for the cast in 'The Walking Dead' since you end up in similar situations and need to escape/fight off the walkers. As far as VR Games go, Arizona Sunshine is very satisfying. For 33$ (on sale), this was a great purchase, and the pace is excellent, as far as VR goes. Will it get you those 20 hours plus campaign that AAA titles often bring? No, but odds are that if you have already spent 600+ on a VR Headset you are willing to put a few more away to use it well. If the goal of your purchase is immersion and fun, you are going to get it.    Happy: +Shooting -The overall shooting mechanics are a bit sketch at first, but once you get used to them the rest of the game it's very satisfying blasting away at zombies.  +Level layout -The game itself is well placed out, and takes you through a decent amount of environments. It is easy to tell it wasn't a copy and paste kind of game.  +Zombies -The zombies are stupid (thank goodness), and there is appropriate variation and types that you really don't feel like you see the same 'Fred' everytime.  +Voice Acting -The voice acting is superb and gives humor to a quite dark situation. I loved it.  +User Choice -While the overall game is like that of an arcade shooter, there are a lot of small decisions you learn to make as the game progresses, like planning for an imminent assault and assigning your resources responsibly.  +Game Aesthetics -They did a wonderful job with the looks of the game, including weapons, lighting and general grime. As far as VR goes, this really helps add to the realism.   Crappy: -Ammo -Ammunition is almost always found in containers. Not quite realistic, and I would have preffered that the placements of ammunition make sense in certain places.  -Weapon Variety -Basically all guns can be summed to 4 types. Weapon design is cool, but I wish there were more modified weapons, and maybe even a two handed assault rifle.  -Survival -As a shooter this is very satisfying, but survival almost seems a given. Adding mechanics for finding water or food would be great, even if it's just having a drink and another line of dialogue.  -Storage -You store things on your body, and I really wish I could put to use many things I would find like water.  -Stealth -There is a lack of stealth. Melee weapons could fix this.  -Scavenging -I wish there was a reward for scavenging about, like random chances to find a mod for a gun, extra ammo, a Fred in some rediculous outfit or some extra dialogue. As is, you just follow the set story line and pick up whatever you find.   -Environment -I really wish I could use surrounding elements to my advantage. Perhaps blow something up holding a car back, and have it roll down and run over some Freds? Maybe pick up items and throw them to distract Freds while I sneak away? Craft rudimentary items with the stuff I found?

They responded to us, likely because of the overwhelming crash of people who didn't even play the game before obliterating it. But, they enabled the mode and I gotta say it's pretty damn fun. Ideally they will tighten up the campaign and MP netcode, but it's gotta be a pain in the ♥♥♥ in VR. At any rate, I'm leaving my previous review that had a thumbs down, but I'm changing it since I've seen studios take much longer than 24 hours to even respond, much less give in to a torrent of angry customers.   Let's see if we forced them to make the wrong decision. 10/10 would participate again. Til then it's horde mode.   -----------------------------  The game at it's core is fine, but they have walled off everyone without an i7 until March of next year.   Aside from being mind-bottlingly stupid, it was presumptuous to say the least to think a game as shallow as this one would be popular enough in 6 months for anyone to care about the additions.   VR gamers are a small group, and this ham-fisted attempt to make money at the cost of fracturing a budding market really shouldn't go unchecked.  --------------------
Bloody Fantastic!  Excellent zombie game and by far the best game for Vive i have played so far. if you have a Vive you owe it to yourself to play this game!

So far, almost great. (Note, I'm running an HTC Vive)  Pros: --Co-op -- there is some, and it's fun!  --System requirements -- they're lower than I had expected. I planned on it beating my PC up. i'm running an OC'd version of a GTX 970, and an Intel i5 4690K at stock speed. It defaulted to high settings and I never had any hiccups related to low FPS or anything. --Gun-play is merciless. I've had to learn to always aim carefully, and I've taken to putting my right wrist on top of my left to steady my aim, just like when I'm at the range. When I do, I'm not let down. --Scavenging is necessary. Thanks to Job Simulator, I quickly tried to eat a hamburger patty, which restored some health. Kudos on that clever little addition. Also nice to be forced to break a glass display sufficiently enough to be able to reach through to grab the contents.  Cons: --Teleport mechanic is adequate, but not as good as Call of the Starseed. Theirs lets you rotate the direction you face, which really helps to orient yourself to line up your available Chaperone space with the virtual environment. I constantly was facing a right-in-front-of-me-wall, when i'd rather rotate to physically face another direction so I'd have more freedom to move. --Co-Op -- really a 2-edged sword.  ---I love that it's there and I had a great 2-3 hours trying it out. They do a good job of not letting you get separated, but I would love to be able to share ammunition one magazine at a time. If it's available, I didn't know how to do it. Otherwise, I'd have to play charades with someone who wasn't using a Microphone to go ' hey, you look over here!! (points wildly).' ---The matchmaking is still young for this game, so I'll give it a pass on the rating side, but it's worth pointing out that half of the times I tried to connect, the app would either freeze, with no indication that the map had stopped loading, or it would immediately crash. ---The avatars for other players are just ridiculous, to the point of hilarity. At first I couldn't stop laughing at my buddy, only to realize it wasn't just him. They are very poorly animated, but I understand the limitations as to the 'why.' All the game has to determine player orientation is the presence of the HMD and wands, so hands and head. The game also assumes that the avatar feet should always be on the ground -- a good assumption. So in theory, it seems like a good idea, but in practice, they end up looking like marionettes with feet magnetized to the ground, and the buttocks all up in the air like on the receiving end of a proctologist with a prosthetic telephone pole.  All in all, great game!  I know the matchmaking will improve-- it's an issue many games experience right after release, and it's a shame that it happens, but it's just the way it works.  Last, to the developers -- PLEASE OH PLEASE FIX THE AVATARS. I don't mind if they look more 'Mannequin-ey' if it has to be that way, but the marionnette thing is definitely something that takes away from the immersion.  --Cheese

This game is worth the money!  We played this game yesterday for a lot of hours and it was really fun.  Since many people complaining about a game which is not complete, we didn't had that experience. The game was running mostly bug and crash free. We had only a really small amount of bugs and just one crash in likely 8h playing.

Wow... Just Wow! This is my first Steam review, but I just had to write it after playing for a few hours.  I just purchased my HTC Vive a few weeks ago and this is the first game that I've been truely addicted to. It's the first VR game I've played that has amazing gameplay and high production values. This is exactly what I was looking for when I bought thge Vive: an accurate shooter that makes me feel part of the world I'm playing in.  How real does it feel? It actually introduces a sense of panic in me when I start getting overwhelmed by hoards of zombies. I have caught myself on multiple occasions screaming at the zombies and starting to shoot wildly just to survive. I even started kneeling down while shooting on occasion to steady my hand (and it works exactly how it does with real handguns).  This game gives me great hope for the VR games coming out in the near future. It's a definite must-have for anyone looking for a great shooter.

Glad to see hardware exclusivity was removed promptly. No more of that guys! But other wise good game, had some issues with multi players horde mode and general stability but im sure those will get fixed. Keep up the good work. But again no more hardware nonsense....

Ah, yes, a game that I waited for since Node made their video on it before the Vive was even out! What can I say? It's a AAA zombie game on the Vive!  Great graphics, a fun and cinematic campaign, multiplayer, and great feelings overall!  The only gripes are the length and buginess. I beat the campaign in only a few hours, and have ran into quite a few bugs during my time (weird sound issue, lag on later waves in Horde mode), but wow, it was all still really worth it, and I plan on playing a lot more!

Very entertaining and adrenaline inducing (seriously!). I'm fine with horror games, but this is visceral; which is why it is great, except before bed, cause it's hard to wind-down after fighting for your life in a horde of running zombies.   Overall, polished gameplay and environments. Straight-forward action (not a bad thing!), but shooting/handling and multitasking skills are challenged on the hard-difficulty. The simplicity of reloading and nade-throwing works well in this style of game. Grenades are fun:)

I have been playing this for a few hours with the Oculus and new Touch controllers. It is a great game, and really enjoying it. The only gripe is I would like to use the joystick to walk as an option.  I would recomend this game!

The Good: Made for VR, fun shooting action, exploration, environmenal interaction. The Bad: Get's a bit repetitive when fighting zombie waves, but the rest of the game is good. The Ugly: Ocasionally crashes on level load.
A great game for flexing your VR system. lots of fun, difficult enough to be a challenge, and solid gameplay.

This game is fantastic! To date it's the most fun I have had with the HTC Vive. Thank god for check points! This game is not easy and you will die. Make sure if your in a bind press on a little bit and get to that check point!  P.S. Pull the pin on the grenade before your throw it. :P
Best experience I've had with VR until now! Fully recommend this game.
This is by far the best game released for VR to date. It is a must have if you have the HTC Vive!
Zombie shooting solo or co-op with friends has never been so polished. Well done for sure. Keep showing up those big timers!
Really fun game. Good combo of zombie shooting and story / adventure. One of the best full-games so far.
we want more locomotion options!

Despite the decision by the Devs to lock out some content for people without new i7's, this game is incredible. Easily the most fun I have had in VR so far. Do co op campaign with a good friend and you will be in tears from laughing, and in tears from being scared at times. It's not overwhelmingly scary, just the right amount of spooks for me. It's a mix of survival and exploration. The world is beautiful and the graphics are some of the best I've seen on the vive for a game of this size. Survival, guns, simple problem solving, and oh yeah, zombies. This game is great. The animations for the zombies actually look very realistic, even when you shoot them it looks very convincing. Several times when I was playing I was convinced there were actual people coming towards me. Despite what the dev has chosen to do, don't overlook this game. It is great. And the only thing you would be missing without an i7 is the single player hoard. Not a huge loss in my opinion. The game is well worth the money, and IMO a must have for any Vive owner.

So far I've played maybe an hour or so of this game on hard. I'm really enjoying the game because while there's no real 'horror' to the game. It's made me panic once or twice when I've got Zeds (or Fred's as the game calls them) barrelling down on me and I turn point my gun and 'click'. The frantic reloading that ensues while I'm trying to grab at a different gun on my belt is quite an adrenaline rush.  Story so far seems fairly basic and the main character does get a bit grating at times in my own opinion with his almost constant 'humourous remarks'. But I can set that aside for the fun gunplay and the panic induced reloads when put in a tight spot. I haven't played this in multiplayer or in the horde mode versions yet, but that's going to be coming up soon once I've played through the main story.  This is what VR gaming needed though, an honest to god full game.

I don't care about the i7 contreversy -- this just isn't a very good game. The world is barren. Not because of the apocalypse...but because there's no world-building going on. No detail in the levels. No interactivity. Just...the same thing, over and over. The assets are NOT scaled properly. This kills the immersion. It feels like an early alpha! Avoid this until they totally rehaul it. Seems rushed out the door for Touch.

I refunded this game during the Intel debacle that has now been reversed. However, I still don't think this game is particularly wonderful. I did not finish it, but some basic thingsI would expect from a title of this price just weren't there. There were also weird quirks that weren't well explained.   1) Things as basic as glass breaking when shot are behind an advanced settings checkbox that supposedly should only be run on i7 CPUs. I wound up turning it on to try and it worked fine on my i5-6600.  2) Touching things with your hands did nothing unless you used the grip buttons. There is no collision between your hands and objects unless you are using the grip button. (Admittedly did not try this after ticking the aforementioned checkbox).  3) Zombies did not react to grippable objects when thrown near them.  4) There were a lot of grippable objects that seemed like something you would use in a Zombie scenario, but actually did nothing (Medpacks, compass, lanterns, etc.)  5) Eating food restores your health but a medpack doesn't?  6) Aiming in this game just felt... off compared to other games I've played. The sights were also often hard to see. White, neon, or glowing dots on the sights would help a lot.  7) Several nooks and crannies that seemed like somewhere you would find supplies, an easter egg, or SOMETHING and they were just dead ends.  8) more locomotion options would be good. From what I could see there was no way to rotate your play area when teleporting like in The Gallery.  9) Filing cabinet bottom drawers not accessible at all, probably so Oculus users wouldn't lose tracking close to the ground.  All this being said, it may be the longest VR game available from what I've seen and read. The voiceover character was pretty good. The environments were good, but not amazing. I enjoyed scavenging for supplies in cars and other areas, but this could be deeper as I mentioned above. A lot of items are there just for you to pickup and then put down again.

Controls are horrible! there are times I would accidentally drop an ammo clip to ground and then I I couldn't reach down far enough to pick it backup? Guns are inaccurate. There are many items to pick pick up BUT DO NOTHING WITH?!? No Melee attacks in a zombie game? Refund requested. There are Better games to spend $33 on. Too bad, because I was looking forward to this game.

I don't normally post reviews but this game is awesome!!  I was sceptical if it would play on my GTX970 but it runs absolutely great. OK Im not on the top notch graphics options but the immersion is still amazing all the same! I've play lots of VR titles since getting the Vive and this one makes me want to upgrade my graphics card to see it for its full eye candy.  I was dubious about paying £25 but it's well worth it!
THIS GAME IS AWESOME!!! Finally a really good VR shooter!
I'm not even done yet but I can already say that it was worth the buy. A great game which makes me exited about the future!
Edit: Content gating until march 2017 unless you have an i7 processor. REFUNDED!  A campaign is nice in a VR game for once, but the gunplay very dissapointing.

Very awesome game! I like it! There is few bugs, but i hope they will be fixed soon..  Anyway i dont find the way to change control setup, as the default one is bit weird for me.. But except that the game it self is very nice! Recommend!

One of the best VR games released to date. Looks beautiful, the weapons feel great, the shots on the zombies feel weighty and substantial, and most importantly its not just another wave shooter. You're an actual character, on a journey, like a proper game. We need to make sure more of these games are supported because I don't think most of the VR community realise how fragile the future of VR development is. Numerous developers have said a) that there's no money in it, and b) certain elements of the community are toxic and abusive. If real fans want to see this latest attempt at VR stick around, we need to do our bit. This is a great VR game.
This is the most complete and polished VR title to date that is available on the HTC Vive (With the exception of Elite Dangerous). A must buy!

Absolutely brilliant game. This is what VR is all about. The atmosphere, the drama, the gunplay - all top notch. Playing coop is a blast too - especially when you go down the mine and your mate is the only one with a torch and all you have is a mildly luminous glow stick! Never stepped into the darkness so cautiously in my life!  Love it, love it, love it.  Well done!!

As of today, it's a insanely good VR game, but i have to say no. I do not recommend it as this hour.  1: insane loading times 2: bad server menu (use steam match making instead) and barely find any other players either (sat 10 minutes wating for people, and when i found one and start the game, the game crashed) 3: alot of game crashes.  So will wait a while until most of the issues is fixed.
I was going to refund but then the developers gave us the 2 games modes we were missing out on. Only took a day. Give this game a chance now.
Really ♥♥♥♥ing great. One of the best games out for Vive right now! Go play it

Great game but buggy.  Very fun game, love everything about it apart from the fact it crashes roughly every 30 mins.  Have tried all the troubleshooting instructions the devs have supplied but issues still persists. Look around and you will see this is a common problem amongst others.  Cannot recommend in the games current state.

This game is boring and repetitive and certainly does not quantify the outrageous pricetag. Especially after the rocky start this game has been having and still is having almost a month after release! There is nothing new being done here, it's just another zombie shooting arcade game.
The trajectory of bullets is completely different to where you aim and teleport breaks the immersion and feels unatural.

Is this another zombie shooter? Yes. Does it rely on immersion breaking teleportation? Yes. If that bothers you stop reading. It's not for you. If you aren't a ♥♥♥♥ keep reading.  Arizona Sunshine is a zombie shooter with some serious production value behind it. The environments look good, zombies look good. Shooting is pretty good. I dig the narrator and I often find myself saying what he says before he says it (I said stay back...)  Do I wish there was a more fluid method of locomotion? Yes, but that is not a deal breaker for me. The teleportation using the familiar parabolic arc that the lab and others have is fine and I quickly forgot where I was in my room and indeed just sort of teleported around, shoot everything, teleport some more.  The gun sounds are the one area that doesn't feel quite right. I may be biased from playing so much hotdogs, horseshoes, and hand grenades, but the shots sound weak and lack the punch I am looking for.  I recommend you get this game if you like shooting zombies in a well built environment. I have yet to try multiplayer or the horde mode yet so I cannot comment on them. If 30 or 40 dollars is a significant investment for you then maybe wait until a sale but I am happy paying 30 for it because I can see where that money went (the environments).  Thanks for some fun zombie shooting!

Arizona sunshine is fun to play.   The game play/pace is slower than I thought it may be but that doesnt take anything away from it. The zombies move much slower than the ones from games such as Left for Dead but fast enough to make it exciting when there are a few of them coming at you at once.  I have found that the aiming at ranged target with pistols is quite difficult and I hope that the developers will tweak that to allow those of us who are not marksmen to be able to hit the target at range a little easier.  I would rate the game 7/10 and hope that additional content will be added going forward. Not DLC but improvements to the game to allow better use of the objects, movement or environment and tweaks to the game like the aiming.
Great game. A full single player campaign, in VR. Some of the most fun shooting zombies I've had.

An incredible game. While many games hint at the possibility of VR, Arizona Sunshine is the first that feels like a full game for me.  The central gameplay mechanics of exploring to scavenge and trying to headshot zombies works extremely well.  What I appreciate most about it is it is never cheap. There are no jump scares and zombies never spawn behind you (at least so far) and the game rewards slow exploration and precision headshots. In this regard it is not really a horror game, although they do put you in some 'scary' situations, it'll only be as scary as you are brave.  The graphics and sounds are great and the performance is smooth.

An incredible game. While many games hint at the possibility of VR, Arizona Sunshine is the first that feels like a full game for me.  The central gameplay mechanics of exploring to scavenge and trying to headshot zombies works extremely well.  What I appreciate most about it is it is never cheap. There are no jump scares and zombies never spawn behind you (at least so far) and the game rewards slow exploration and precision headshots. In this regard it is not really a horror game, although they do put you in some 'scary' situations, it'll only be as scary as you are brave.  The graphics and sounds are great and the performance is smooth.

I strongly recommend this game. I get a feel of Dying Light, The Last of Us, and Walking Dead. The Zombie AI could use some improvements, but even as such, i found some moments to be a challenge(Walking Dead-esque) A few zombies are managable, but get swarmed and you are quickly put in your place. Although the overall game is linear, there are times where you need to explore various locations to locate important items to continue the story. My favorite bit is how at times you get swarmed and are expected to 'move' to a key location while fighting off the zombies to continue. If you sit there gunning down the zombies you'll eventually run out of ammo and die. This is one of the first VR titles i feel really got gameplay down right.  I am running an i5 processor with a GTX980. I set the settings to MAX, and get all the gore and extra zombies. I saw minimal dropped framerates. With i7, as recommended, i suspect it would be butter. I am one of the rare few who are NOT affected by laggy motion and dropped frames. I'd rather get the full experience and have some VR lag, than miss out because of my rig. I do not suggest this for most as this may affect your experience negatively.  There are opportunities to explore and find hidden items. Scavenging is a must! Sometimes this means going into that dark scary tunnel full of scary sounds! It was genuinly terrifying at times.  All in all, this is a great game, if only to showcase things to come in VR,

This has been the most polished full game type experience I've had in VR yet. The shooting is great, the looting is also great, and the story and exploration keep it all interesting. I'm really glad they went with blink locomotion as well. I tell ya what, I could really get used to blinking around IRL!  That said, it is still a fairly early period for games in VR, so don't expect AAA polish. There is some silliness in the setting, with oddly scaled items and some wonky looking stuff, but it doesn't detract much.  My only real gripe is that there doesn't feel like there's much benefit to picking up new weaponst. All of them seem to have the same stopping power with just variations in ammo capacity, sight picture, and maybe some other mechanic, like the glock being an auto-pistol. I wish things like the deagle had greater stopping power to trade off for the tiny magazine. I feel like the magnum revolver was better at one-hit killing at a distance, though. Not sure about that.  I definitely plan to go back and play through this again on a few different settings and try to get a better feel for the guns.  In the future, I'd love to see a game like this expand upon the looting and hoarding that are necessary in such a survival scenario. If this game were an open world zombie survival game like a VR version of Project Zomboid, I would probably never leave VR again.
